instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, will run off power or battery but no charge
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, will run off power or battery but no charge, no indications of water damage. board is super clean. Checked DC in board and jumper. SMC reset was 1.9v but <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> was 3.4v. checked the pull up resistor and it was 100k as its supposed to be. I replaced <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> and now my SMC reset is 2.9v but it seems it will move around. still no light on charger. i suspect bad SMC. not sure though what should i try.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, will run off power or battery but no charge
threads.message: BTW i get fan spin no prob

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, will run off power or battery but no charge
threads.message: BTW customer took this to apple store and they said they replace th IO board which i suspect is the DC in board. this was before it was brought to us.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, will run off power or battery but no charge
threads.message:
Machine should work without flex connected between logic board and LIO board.
Do this in case you suspect something bad on LIO board.

Is battery recognized on OSX?
Post PPBUS voltage with only charger connected.
Also post it with battery alone and finally with both charger and battery connected
Post voltage at pin15 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> too.

Check voltage and resistance to ground on SCL/SDA from battery bus.
Reflow SMC using quality flux, to burn the crap underneath.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, will run off power or battery but no charge
threads.message:
Battery is recognized under OS X

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 8.53v with charger only charger with batt 8.57 batt only 7.3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> charger and battery and battery only same reading 3.42 v

pin15 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> seems to be .079v with any config of battery and charger

SCL 3.4v
SDL 3.4v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, will run off power or battery but no charge
threads.message: 100k ohms on both SCL and SDL when tested from pin9 of j6950 to pin4 and pin5 of j6950.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, will run off power or battery but no charge
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No light, will run off power or battery but no charge
threads.message: Have you tried a known good IO board and flat cable? Without green/orange light it will not charge ever.
